level-up.name: quick-attack
level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: double-team
level-up.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

level-up.name: leech-life
level-up.description:
The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is
restored by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: acid-spray
level-up.description:
The user spits fluid that works to melt the target.
This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

level-up.name: acid-spray
level-up.description:
The user spits fluid that works to melt the target.
This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

level-up.name: double-team
level-up.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

level-up.name: quick-attack
level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: struggle-bug
level-up.description:
While resisting, the user attacks opposing Pokémon.
This lowers the Sp. Atk stats of those hit.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: mega-drain
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: swift
level-up.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

level-up.name: me-first
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect:
If the target has selected a damaging move this turn, the user will copy that move and use it against the target, with a 50% increase in power.

If the target moves before the user, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: giga-drain
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: u-turn
level-up.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

level-up.name: bug-buzz
level-up.description:
The user generates a damaging sound wave by
vibration. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: recover
level-up.description:
Restoring its own cells, the user restores its own HP
by half of its max HP.
level-up.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.

level-up.name: power-swap
level-up.description:
The user employs its psychic power to switch
changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with
the target.
level-up.effect: User swaps its Attack and Special Attack stat modifiers modifiers with the target.

level-up.name: final-gambit
level-up.description:
The user risks everything to attack its target. The
user faints but does damage equal to its HP.
level-up.effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP.  User faints.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: giga-drain
tutor.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

tutor.name: sleep-talk
tutor.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
tutor.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

tutor.name: knock-off
tutor.description:
The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that
item can’t be used in that battle. The move does
more damage if the target has a held item.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

tutor.name: signal-beam
tutor.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

tutor.name: gastro-acid
tutor.description:
The user hurls up its stomach acids on the target.
The fluid eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability.
tutor.effect:
The target's ability is disabled as long as it remains on the field.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

tutor.name: bug-bite
tutor.description:
The user bites the target. If the target is holding a
Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca berry or rowap berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: venoshock
machine.description:
The user drenches the target in a special poisonous
liquid. This move’s power is doubled if the target
is poisoned.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: hyper-beam
machine.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sludge-bomb
machine.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may
also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: sandstorm
machine.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all
combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: energy-ball
machine.description:
The user draws power from nature and fires it at the
target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: giga-impact
machine.description:
The user charges at the target using every bit of its
power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: struggle-bug
machine.description:
While resisting, the user attacks opposing Pokémon.
This lowers the Sp. Atk stats of those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

Value | Type

    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric

   13 | ice

   15 | dark

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.description:

The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sludge-bomb
machine.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may
also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: sandstorm
machine.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all
combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: energy-ball
machine.description:
The user draws power from nature and fires it at the
target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: giga-impact
machine.description:
The user charges at the target using every bit of its
power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: struggle-bug
machine.description:
While resisting, the user attacks opposing Pokémon.
This lowers the Sp. Atk stats of those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: infestation
machine.description:
The target is infested and attacked for four to five
turns. The target can’t flee during this time.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid spin cancels this effect.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

level-up.name: absorb
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: quick-attack
level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: double-team
level-up.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

level-up.name: power-swap
level-up.description:
The user employs its psychic power to switch
changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with
the target.
level-up.effect: User swaps its Attack and Special Attack stat modifiers modifiers with the target.

level-up.name: acid-spray
level-up.description:
The user spits fluid that works to melt the target.
This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

level-up.name: final-gambit
level-up.description:
The user risks everything to attack its target. The
user faints but does damage equal to its HP.
level-up.effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP.  User faints.

level-up.name: water-shuriken
level-up.description:
The user hits the target with throwing stars two to
five times in a row. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times.

level-up.name: acid-spray
level-up.description:
The user spits fluid that works to melt the target.
This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

level-up.name: quick-attack
level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: struggle-bug
level-up.description:
While resisting, the user attacks opposing Pokémon.
This lowers the Sp. Atk stats of those hit.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: mega-drain
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: swift
level-up.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

level-up.name: me-first
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect:
If the target has selected a damaging move this turn, the user will copy that move and use it against the target, with a 50% increase in power.

If the target moves before the user, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: giga-drain
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: u-turn
level-up.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

level-up.name: bug-buzz
level-up.description:
The user generates a damaging sound wave by
vibration. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: recover
level-up.description:
Restoring its own cells, the user restores its own HP
by half of its max HP.
level-up.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.

level-up.name: power-swap
level-up.description:
The user employs its psychic power to switch
changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with
the target.
level-up.effect: User swaps its Attack and Special Attack stat modifiers modifiers with the target.

level-up.name: final-gambit
level-up.description:
The user risks everything to attack its target. The
user faints but does damage equal to its HP.
level-up.effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP.  User faints.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: venoshock
machine.description:
The user drenches the target in a special poisonous
liquid. This move’s power is doubled if the target
is poisoned.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: hyper-beam
machine.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: leech-life
machine.description:
The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is
restored by half the damage taken by the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.
